intro: Calycadenia multiglandulosa, commonly known as the multiglandular globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, ovate leaves with glandular structures. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Calycadenia multiglandulosa is often found in open, sunny areas and is adapted to arid environments.
